definition: (classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: They spend long hours staring at the screen with few breaks.
sentences.chinese: 他们长时间地注视屏幕，几乎不休息。

sentences.english: Consequently, you will find that almost every one owns either a watch or a clock.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你会发现几乎每个人都拥有一只表或一个钟。

sentences.english: Hard find … a mossy leaf-tailed gecko is nearly impossible to spot on tree.
sentences.chinese: 这只苔藓满身的扁叶尾壁虎趴在树上，几乎认不出来。

sentences.english: I still tend to move my fingers, almost subconsciously, when doing arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 当做算术时，几乎是下意识的，我还是会想去掰手指。

sentences.english: The poor old man plods along, hardly able to lift each food.
sentences.chinese: 这可怜白勺白叟吃力地走着，几乎都抬不动脚了。

sentences.english: On summer evenings the flowers gave forth an almost intoxicating scent.
sentences.chinese: 夏夜，花朵发出几乎醉人的芳香。

sentences.english: They are able to cut through metal and are nearly impossible to destroy.
sentences.chinese: 它们可以切割金属，也几乎无法摧毁。

sentences.english: Of the original scheme hardly a wrack remains.
sentences.chinese: 原来的计划几乎一点残迹也未留下。

sentences.english: The negotiating groups have developed consolidated legal text in virtually all negotiating groups.
sentences.chinese: 谈判小组在几乎所有的谈判中均已完成法律文本合并。

sentences.english: My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我的花园里飞舞着很多蝴蝶，我几乎看不见花了。

sentences.english: However, since her return, Chapman has become something of a national hero.
sentences.chinese: 但是，自查普曼归国后，她几乎已是民族英雄。

sentences.english: It is excellent to carve as it hardly splinters at all.
sentences.chinese: 对于雕刻件它是极好的，因为它几乎不碎裂。

sentences.english: Nearlly all the sports practised nowadays are competitive.
sentences.chinese: 今天几乎所有的体育活动都是竞赛性的。

sentences.english: We rarely think to question the financialconcepts we believe in and follow.—Garrett B. Gunderson, Killing Sacred Cows
sentences.chinese: 我们几乎不去质疑自己相信和遵循的理财观念。

sentences.english: Those misfortunes almost deprived him of his reason.
sentences.chinese: 那些不幸事件几乎使他失去理智。

sentences.english: Watching, I was moved almost to tears.
sentences.chinese: 此情此景让我感动得几乎落泪。

definition: all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
in large part/the greater part/the majority
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
